marketNews.title: Trump Announces Reciprocal Tariffs, China Retaliates
marketNews.content: US President, Donald Trump, on April 2, 2025, announced reciprocal tariffs with a minimum rate of 10% for all imports to the US. Additionally, Trump imposed higher tariffs on 57 countries that are the source of the US trade deficit [see table]. The implementation of the minimum 10% reciprocal tariff will start on April 5, 2025, while the higher tariffs for the 57 countries will take effect on April 9, 2025. The reciprocal tariffs are an addition to existing import tariffs, if any. For example, the total import tariff for China as of April 9, 2025, will reach 54%, consisting of a 34% reciprocal tariff and a 20% existing tariff. Meanwhile, Trump excluded Mexico and Canada from these reciprocal tariffs. Trump also stated that several commodities are exempted from the imposition of reciprocal tariffs, including semiconductors, copper, medical goods, and pharmaceuticals. Two days after Trump's announcement, China announced it would retaliate by imposing an additional 34% import tariff on all products from the US, effective April 10, 2025. Furthermore, China will also restrict the export of rare earths to the US starting April 4, 2025. Responding to these plans, Trump threatened that the US would re-impose an additional 50% tariff on China if the country's government did not cancel the retaliatory tariffs against the US. On the other hand, the Chinese Ministry of Commerce affirmed it 'will fight until the end' to protect its national interests. Besides China, the European Union has released a proposal regarding 25% reciprocal tariffs on several US import products starting May 16, 2025. This proposal is a response to the tariffs imposed by the US on steel and aluminum imports from Europe since March 12, 2025. Domestically, the Indonesian government stated it would not take retaliatory measures, opting instead for diplomacy and negotiation to find the best solution. Next week, the Indonesian government will send a team - including the Minister of Finance, Sri Mulyani - to negotiate the tariffs set by the US government. The US is Indonesia's second-largest export destination country (after China), with export value reaching US$26.3 billion during 2024, equivalent to ~10% of total export value and ~2% of Indonesia's GDP. Based on commodities, the 'Top 5' largest US imports from Indonesia during 2024 are: 1) Electrical machinery and equipment (such as cables and modems); 2) Clothing and accessories (knitted and not knitted); 3) Footwear; 4) Animal/vegetable oils (such as palm oil products); and 5) Rubber and rubber products (such as tires). On Tuesday (8/4), the IHSG weakened by -7.9% and the Indonesian government bond yield for the 10-year tenor increased by about +8 bps to 7.08%, while the Rupiah exchange rate against the US dollar weakened by 1.9% to 16,865, marking its all-time low. In the period of April 2-7, 2025, the S&P 500 plunged by -10.7%, with Nasdaq at -11.4% and EIDO at -7.2%. Stock markets in Asia also experienced declines in the period of April 2-8, 2025, with Nikkei 225 at -7.6%, SSE at -6.1%, and HSI at -13.3%. Key Takeaway: Generally, the trade war will have a negative impact on Indonesian exports, both directly (increasing selling prices and reducing demand for tariffed products) and indirectly (global economic weakening due to the trade war reducing overall Indonesian exports). Although there is an opportunity for Indonesia to increase/capture market share from countries facing higher tariffs - thus making their exports less competitive relative to Indonesia - this still depends on the negotiations conducted between various countries (including Indonesia) and the US later on. We advise investors to avoid panic selling and stay invested if investors believe the stocks they invest in have good fundamentals. History shows that the market can recover from crises, such as in 2008 and 2020. Additionally, having a diversified portfolio across various asset classes can help minimize the impact of market volatility. Investors can consider short-term government bonds that have lower volatility - such as PBS003 and ST014-T2 - or money market mutual funds.

marketNews.title: BPS noted that consumer price index (CPI) inflation in Indonesia reached 1.03% YoY in March 2025
marketNews.content: BPS noted that consumer price index (CPI) inflation in Indonesia reached 1.03% YoY in March 2025 (vs. Feb 2025: 0.09% YoY deflation), lower than the consensus expectation which projected 1.16% YoY inflation. Nevertheless, this is the highest annual inflation since December 2024. On a monthly basis, CPI inflation reached 1.65% MoM (vs. Feb 2025: 0.48% MoM deflation), lower than the consensus expectation projecting 1.79% MoM inflation, although it marks the highest level since December 2014 following the expiration of electricity tariff discounts in February 2025. Meanwhile, core inflation reached 2.48% YoY, the same as February 2025 and still marking the highest level in the last 20 months, although lower than the consensus expectation of 2.5% YoY.

marketNews.title: BEI on Tuesday (8/4) announced changes to the maximum lower auto rejection limit
marketNews.content: BEI on Tuesday (8/4) announced a change in the maximum lower auto rejection limit to -15% for main board stocks, development board stocks, new economy board stocks, as well as exchange-traded funds (ETF) and real estate investment funds (DIRE) for all price ranges. Additionally, BEI also changed the trading halt activation threshold to -8% for a 30-minute suspension, -15% for a subsequent 30-minute suspension, and -20% until the end of the trading session or longer. This policy is effective as of April 8, 2025.

marketNews.title: S&P Global noted that Indonesia's manufacturing Purchasing Managers' Index (PMI) fell to 52.4 in March 2025
marketNews.content: S&P Global noted that Purchasing Managers' Index (PMI) manufacturing in Indonesia fell to the level of 52.4 in March 2025 (vs. Feb 2025: 53.6), marking an expansion level for 4 consecutive months. Industry players' confidence remains stable near the highest level in the last 35 months recorded in February 2025, supported by optimism about new product launches and sustained economic improvement.

marketNews.title: S&P Global noted that China's manufacturing Purchasing Managers' Index (PMI) rose to 51.2 in March 2025
marketNews.content: S&P Global noted that Purchasing Managers' Index (PMI) manufacturing in China rose to the level of 51.2 in March 2025 (vs. Feb 2025: 50.8), exceeding the consensus expectation of 51.1 and marking the highest level since November 2024 along with output increase amid improving demand conditions. Nevertheless, industry players' confidence weakened due to rising uncertainty, especially regarding the trade war.

marketNews.title: Institute for Supply Management (ISM) noted that the services sector Purchasing Managers' Index (PMI) in the US dropped sharply to 50.8 in March 2025
marketNews.content: Institute for Supply Management (ISM) noted that the Purchasing Managers' Index (PMI) sector services in the US dropped sharply to the level of 50.8 in March 2025 (vs. Feb 2025: 53.5), well below the consensus expectation of 53 and marking the weakest expansion in the services sector since June 2024. ISM noted that there was a significant increase in the number of respondents reporting cost increases due to import tariffs. In separate economic data, the US Bureau of Labor Statistics noted that the US economy added 228,000 non-farm jobs in March 2025 (vs. Feb 2025: 117,000 jobs), exceeding the consensus expectation of 135,000 and marking the highest level in the last 3 months.

tickerNews.title: $PTBA registers net profit of 1.9 trillion rupiah in 4Q24, resulting in 5.1 trillion rupiah for 2024
tickerNews.content: PTBA: Bukit Asam registered a net profit of 1.9 trillion rupiah in 4Q24 (+56.4% QoQ, -19.5% YoY). This result brought the net profit for 2024 to 5.1 trillion rupiah (-16.4% YoY), exceeding expectations as it equals 115%/113% of Stockbit/consensus 2024F estimates. Quarterly net profit growth in 4Q24 was driven by revenue increase (+10% QoQ) and gross profit margin (+140 bps QoQ), in line with sales volume growth (+3.6% QoQ) and average selling price (+5.3% QoQ). Additionally, quarterly net profit growth in 4Q24 was also supported by a surge in income from associates and JVs (+215.1% QoQ) and a decrease in tax expense (-34.9% QoQ). For 2025, PTBA management targets a production volume of 50.05 million tons (+15.6% YoY from 2024 realization), sales volume of 50.09 million tons (+16.8% YoY from 2024 realization), and a stripping ratio of 6.49x (vs. 2024 realization: 6.2x).

tickerNews.title: $GGRM records net loss of 11 billion rupiah in 4Q24
tickerNews.content: GGRM: Gudang Garam recorded a net loss of 11 billion rupiah in 4Q24 (vs. 4Q23: 867 billion rupiah net profit, 3Q24: 67 billion rupiah net profit). This result brought the net profit for 2024 to 981 billion rupiah (-81.6% YoY), below expectations (30.9% of consensus 2024F estimate). Revenue decline and increasing opex were the 2 main factors for the low performance in 4Q24. Revenue was recorded at 24.8 trillion rupiah (-33.4% YoY, +3.7% QoQ), while opex increased to 2 trillion rupiah (+5.3% YoY, -1.7% QoQ), so operating profit margin was only 0.3% in 4Q24 (vs. 4Q23: 3.3%, 3Q24: 0.9%).

tickerNews.title: $SMGR books net profit of 40 million rupiah in 4Q24, significantly lower YoY
tickerNews.content: SMGR: Semen Indonesia booked a net profit of 40 million rupiah in 4Q24 (vs. 4Q23: 457 billion rupiah, 3Q24: 218 billion rupiah). This result brought the net profit for 2024 to 720 billion rupiah (-66.8% YoY), below consensus FY24 estimates (57.7% of consensus). Revenue decline and shrinking gross profit margin were the 2 main factors for the poor performance in 4Q24. Revenue was recorded at 9.9 trillion rupiah (-10% YoY, +0.1% QoQ), while the gross profit margin decreased to 19.4% in 4Q24 (vs. 4Q23: 24.9%, 3Q24: 21.8%).

tickerNews.title: $TPIA's joint venture completes acquisition of Shell Energy and Chemicals Park Singapore
tickerNews.content: TPIA: Chandra Asri Pacific announced that its joint venture with Glencore plc, CAPGC Pte. Ltd., has completed the agreement to acquire the entire ownership of Shell Energy and Chemicals Park Singapore for US$254 million or ~4.2 trillion rupiah assuming an exchange rate of 16,500. The asset has also been officially renamed Aster Chemicals and Energy Pte. Ltd. (Aster). TPIA management stated on Tuesday (8/4) that revenue and profit from this asset will begin to be reflected in the financial statements in 3Q25. In the information disclosure, TPIA conveyed that it will make capital injections according to its participation share of US$587 million to Aster for business development, including the purchase of additional equipment to rejuvenate the asset.

tickerNews.title: $CTRA posts net profit of 849 billion rupiah in 4Q24, exceeding expectations
tickerNews.content: CTRA: Ciputra Development registered a net profit of 849 billion rupiah in 4Q24 (vs. 4Q23: 665 billion rupiah, 3Q24: 248 billion rupiah). This result brought the net profit for 2024 to 2.1 trillion rupiah (+15% YoY), exceeding expectations (104% of consensus 2024F estimate). Net profit growth in 4Q24 was supported by strong revenue growth (+53% YoY, +96% QoQ), especially in the 'Real Estate' segment (+72% YoY, +135% QoQ). Meanwhile, the gross profit margin was under pressure (-890 bps YoY, -160 bps QoQ), especially annually due to the high-base effect in 4Q23.

tickerNews.title: $ACES reports net profit of 318 billion rupiah in 4Q24, exceeding expectations
tickerNews.content: ACES: Aspirasi Hidup Indonesia recorded a net profit of 318 billion rupiah in 4Q24 (+12% YoY, +52% QoQ). This result made the net profit for 2024 reach 892 billion rupiah (+16% YoY), exceeding expectations (104% of consensus 2024F estimate). Revenue in 4Q24 grew +11% YoY and +12% QoQ, so revenue during 2024 grew +13% YoY and in line with expectations (100% of consensus 2024F estimate). Quarterly net profit growth in 4Q24 was primarily driven by gross profit margin expansion (+469 bps QoQ) and operating profit margin (+104 bps QoQ). Throughout 2024, gross profit margin and operating profit margin remained relatively stable at levels of 48.7% (+5 bps YoY) and 13.6% (+38 bps YoY), so operating profit grew +16% YoY and exceeded expectations (112% of consensus 2024F estimate).

tickerNews.title: $ARNA shareholders approve 2024 dividend plan of 43 rupiah per share
tickerNews.content: ARNA: Arwana Citramulia shareholders on Tuesday (8/4) approved the 2024 book year dividend distribution plan of 43 rupiah per share, equivalent to a 72.6% dividend payout ratio and indicating a yield of 6.9% as of Tuesday (8/4). In a public expose on the same day, ARNA management also stated that the board approved an interim dividend distribution plan for the 2025 book year, which will be distributed after the 1H25 financial statements. Additionally, ARNA management announced a net profit growth target of +10% YoY for 2025, with a revenue growth target of +19% YoY, and sales volume of +11% YoY.

tickerNews.title: $TOTL secured new contracts worth IDR 1.23 trillion as of February 2025
tickerNews.content: TOTL: Total Bangun Persada Corporate Secretary, Anggie S. Sidharta, stated that the company recorded new contract value of 1.23 trillion rupiah during 2M25, equivalent to 24.6% of the 2025 target of 5 trillion rupiah. Anggie explained that the new contract value consisted of construction projects for public facilities, industrial, and data centers, although she did not elaborate further.

tickerNews.title: $MAIN records net profit of 129 billion rupiah in 4Q24, reaching 488 billion rupiah for 2024
tickerNews.content: MAIN: Malindo Feedmill Indonesia recorded a net profit of 129 billion rupiah in 4Q24 (+92% QoQ, +633% YoY), resulting in 488 billion rupiah for 2024 (+670% YoY). The increase in net profit in 4Q24 was mainly supported by improvements in the 'DOC' and 'Broiler' segments - which each recorded the highest quarterly operating profit since 2Q18 - as well as the continued strength of the 'Feed' segment. Throughout 2024, net profit was driven by improvements in operating profit margin in the 'DOC' and 'Broiler' segments, causing the 'DOC' segment to break even from a loss in 2023 and the 'Broiler' segment to experience a reduction in loss to 45 billion rupiah (vs. 2023: 218 billion rupiah operating loss).

tickerNews.title: $INKP reports net profit of US$424 million in 2024
tickerNews.content: Indah Kiat Pulp & Paper (INKP) recorded a net profit of US$424 million (+3% YoY) during 2024, supported by an exchange rate gain of US$78 million (vs. 2023: US$25 million exchange loss). Operationally, operating profit reached US$653 million during 2024 (-17% YoY), with operating profit margin decreasing by -220 bps YoY to 20.4% due to an increase in selling expenses (+12% YoY).

tickerNews.title: $TKIM reports net profit of US$297 million in 2024
tickerNews.content: Pabrik Kertas Tjiwi Kimia (TKIM) recorded a net profit of US$297 million (+73% YoY) during 2024, supported by gains from OKI Pulp JV (+45% YoY) and an exchange gain of US$28 million (vs. 2023: US$12 million exchange loss). Operationally, operating profit reached US$69 million during 2024 (+9% YoY), with the operating profit margin increasing by +110 bps YoY to 7%.

tickerNews.title: $ASRI records net profit of 43 billion rupiah in 4Q24, resulting in 213 billion rupiah for 2024
tickerNews.content: ASRI: Alam Sutera Realty recorded a net profit of 43 billion rupiah in 4Q24 (vs. 4Q23: 422 billion rupiah net profit, 3Q24: 6 billion rupiah net loss). This result made the net profit for 2024 reach 213 billion rupiah (-63% YoY). The annual net profit decline in 4Q24 was caused by a decrease in revenue recognition in the 'Housing and Shophouse' segment (-53% YoY, +249% QoQ), which caused revenue recognition in the 'Housing and Shophouse' segment during 2024 to fall by -19% YoY.

tickerNews.title: $CMNP announces share buyback plan up to ~543.7 million shares
tickerNews.content: CMNP: Citra Marga Nusaphala Persada announced a buyback plan of up to ~543.7 million (10%) shares with a fund allocation of up to ~815.6 billion rupiah on May 2 - June 26, 2025. This corporate action does not require AGM approval following the relaxation granted by OJK to support capital market stability.

tickerNews.title: $FORE sets IPO price at 188 rupiah per share for 21.08% stake
tickerNews.content: FORE: Fore Kopi Indonesia set an IPO price of 188 rupiah per share for 1.88 billion (21.08%) new shares, resulting in a potential fund raising of ~353.4 billion rupiah. The funds raised will be used: 76% to open around 140 new outlets, 18% for opening subsidiary-owned new outlets, and 6% for company working capital. The public offering is scheduled to take place on April 8-10, 2025, with a listing schedule on April 14, 2025. During 9M24, FORE recorded a net profit of 42 billion rupiah (reversing from a loss in 9M23), with revenue of 727 billion rupiah (+135% YoY) and same store sales growth (SSSG) of +42% YoY. The company's total outlets reached 217 stores as of 9M24 (+47% YoY).
